intro: Lomelosia simplex subsp. simplex, commonly known as the simple lomelosia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences and are usually white or pale green, with a subtle fragrance. It plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various invertebrates.
